1. Lower cost: Brig ships often offered lower fares compared to other modes of transportation, making them more affordable for common people.

2. Flexibility: Since brig ships were smaller than some other sailing vessels, they could navigate through narrower waterways and get closer to shorelines.

3. Speed: Brig ships were relatively fast, and they could often outpace larger sailing vessels.

4. Ability to carry cargo: Brig ships were often used to transport cargo in addition to passengers, making them a versatile mode of transportation.

5. Experience: Traveling on a brig ship could be a unique experience, providing travelers with the opportunity to see different places and meet new people.
